attributes.action: Negotiate re-entry to the Single Market
attributes.background: Start negotiations to rejoin the EU Single Market
attributes.additional_details: As a result of leaving the Single Market, UK farming,fishing and businesses are failing,resulting in massive unemployment, lost trading opportunities, and huge loss of revenue. Attempting to substitute EU trade with similar in separate far-flung countries, increases produce costs and delivery time-scales, and the urgency to complete these deals, exposes us to ransom by those with whom we seek to trade. They also increase the country's carbon footprint thus accelerating global warming.

government_response.summary: Leaving the EU was the democratic wish of the British public. The Government is now focussed on implementing the Trade and Cooperation Agreement, ensuring it delivers for our citizens and businesses.
government_response.details:
In 2015, the Government was elected with a mandate to hold a referendum on the UK’s membership of the EU. That referendum was held in June 2016 and the British public sent a clear message that they wanted to leave the EU. The Government was again elected in 2017 with a mandate reaffirming this and that the British public wanted the Government to trigger Article 50, the legal mechanism to leave the EU. The Government was, for a third time, re-elected in 2019 with a clear and overwhelming mandate from the British public to pass the necessary legislation to ratify the Withdrawal Agreement and negotiate a trade agreement in line with its manifesto commitment. 

Since 31 December 2020, the UK has been outside the EU’s customs union and Single Market, and is now fully focussed on implementing the Trade and Cooperation Agreement (TCA), which was agreed at the end of 2020. 
The TCA is the world’s largest tariff-free quota-free free trade agreement. The agreement is based on friendly cooperation between sovereign equals, centred on free trade, while establishing close cooperation in areas like transport, digital, and fighting crime.

We are already making huge strides to make the most of our newfound freedoms. For example, we have struck new free trade deals with over 70 countries; we have taken back control of our waters to allow us to better support the UK fishing industry and manage our fisheries; and replaced the Common Agricultural Policy.
The Government is committed to ensuring that all businesses get the support they need to trade effectively with Europe, including through the free-to-use Export Support Service, and to seize new opportunities as we strike trade deals with the world’s fastest growing markets. Our 2025 Border Strategy sets out our ambition to create the most effective border in the world, as we aim to radically simplify the process of importing and exporting to reduce the cost of international trade. 

We have also launched an ambitious Export Strategy to support British businesses exporting globally. The ‘Race to £1 trillion’ worth of exports per year by the end of this decade means more jobs, more opportunities and higher wages, helping to level up the UK and build back better. 

Foreign, Commonwealth & Development Office

departments.name: Foreign, Commonwealth & Development Office

attributes.action: Ban the redevelopment of agricultural land. Protect it for food production.
attributes.background: We would like the government to protect our agricultural / farmland for food production and not allow it to be used for building houses or other projects that would harm the soil or stop it producing food for our nation.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK on average only produces around 50% of the food eaten by its population, with global warming, changing the weather around the world, the UK should no longer rely on vast amounts of food from other countries to feed us,  it is important that we retain the ability to feed  our population, preventing food shortages and starvation in future years.

Only by protecting our farmland will we be able to meet this need for food, if it is no longer available from abroad.

departments.name: Department for Levelling Up, Housing and Communities

attributes.action: Increase funding for flood defences for East Anglia
attributes.background:
We need the Government to provide funding to ensure that infrastructure designed to drain & protect East Anglia from flooding is restored and improved to its full capability.
 
The system must be capable of dealing with the pressures of the 21st century & the future challenges from global warming.
attributes.additional_details:
The threat of flood is real. As seen in December 2020: Homes were flooded, businesses were shut, national infrastructure was closed (A14), people evacuated from their homes and businesses and wildlife habitats destroyed.
 
If this issue is not addressed with urgency this is a man-made disaster waiting to happen. If the flood defences cannot express the surge of water quick enough the defences shall be breached and flooding of a great economic and humanitarian will happen. Action is needed now.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Ban new incinerator and pyrolysis sites and invest in waste reduction
attributes.background: We want the government to follow the example set in the EU by banning any new incinerators for the purpose of waste disposal. They should also ban pyrolysis facilities, and instead seek the solutions we need to reduce waste completely by investing in waste reduction, reuse and recycling.
attributes.additional_details:
Unfortunately waste management companies are benefitting from not having to pay similar taxes to that which are imposed on land-fill.

Communities across the breadth of the UK have campaigned against waste incinerators as many do not want one in their town or city.

The reasons for this are clear:

1) Incinerators risk harm to the health of local residents
2) Incinerators can pollute the air with toxic emissions
3) Incinerator emissions contribute to global warming
4) Incinerators can harm the environment

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Address the Energy, Climate and Environment crisis by investing in Renewables
attributes.background:
It's a no-brainer. This is a crisis the Government must address by the cheapest, quickest, most environmentally friendly, safest, and most job-creative means. 

Promote and increase Government investment in renewables.
attributes.additional_details:
Fossil fuels are ruining the climate and environment. Nuclear is unsafe.

Home-grown renewable energy and insulating our buildings so we don't lose the heat we produce will create more jobs, be cheaper and be quicker in reducing energy prices and global warming.
We ask the Government to think of the good of our country, our global environment and its people.
 
Increase Government investment in:
- Underwater turbines to harness tidal flows and estuary currents
- Wind farms
- Solar panels.
- Battery technology to store energy.
- Insulation of buildings.

Action, not words, are needed.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Covid bail outs for companies in exchange for carbon-reducing commitments.
attributes.background: We call on the chancellor Rishi Sunak to grant public money only to companies which make firm, transparent, carbon-reducing commitments in line with the UN's IPCC recommendations.
attributes.additional_details:
Covid-19 has presented us with empty shelves, personal tragedy and public conflict. A glimpse into a future we may face as a result of climate change. 
 
Rescue packages to help the economy recover from the Covid-19 crisis present a major opportunity for our economy to make the urgent move away from fossil fuel dependency, to one that can grow sustainably and help limit global warming to 1.5°C above pre-industrial levels.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: Run a Public Awareness Campaign about the Climate and Ecological Emergency
attributes.background: We need the government to run a ‘Climate and Ecological Awareness’ public information campaign that will reach as wide an audience as possible.  The government has carried out such campaigns in the past for issues that posed far less danger to our well-being, for example the anti-smoking campaign.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Committee on Climate Change is telling us that we are not currently on track for our 2050 net-zero target and we are likely to see global warming of 2-4 degrees by the end of this century. This is far higher than the levels deemed ‘safe’ in the IPCC special report of 2018.   Many of us are oblivious to the damage that we wreak daily on our environment by our activities.

We all need to get involved in facing the challenge, so that the UK can be a role-model for the rest of the world.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Ban the sale of petrol and diesel cars by 2024, six years earlier than planned
attributes.background: The government's current plan is to end the sale of petrol and diesel cars by 2030. The end of 2030 is almost nine-and-a-half years away. My strongly held belief is that the UK government must act sooner. That is why I am advocating a 2024 cut-off for the sale of petrol and diesel cars.
attributes.additional_details:
It is agreed that petrol and diesel cars are bad; the consensus is that these vehicles cause illness-inducing pollution, and that they also contribute to global warming. Indeed, the danger of the vehicles is why the government's policy is to ban their sale by 2030. 

The debate concerns timing. I think that 2030 is far too distant. These cars are killing now. The climate emergency is occurring now. During times of crisis, it is incumbent to act at the earliest opportunity - and not delay.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Establish and Maintain an Aerial firefighting capability to combat wildfires
attributes.background: The United Kingdom is seeing a rise in record temperatures as a result of global warming. Whilst strategic measures are being taken to moderate these effects, tactically we need to establish a capability to fight heath and forest fires from the air.
attributes.additional_details: Global temperatures are rising and in the UK we have experienced record temperatures year on year and increasing levels of destruction of both wildlife habitat and property. It would be unfortunate if we did nothing to provide effective countermeasures until after the event. It takes about a year to convert a BAe 146 or similar aircraft to firefighting configuration so we could if we wanted to have capability in place for next summer.

departments.name: Home Office

attributes.action: Set minimum energy efficiency standards for retail fridges
attributes.background:
Supermarket refrigeration uses 1% of the UK's energy.
Inefficient fridge design leads to:
1) wasted energy
2) food spoilage and waste as temperature varies across the cabinet
3) increased plastic packaging to protect food that is kept at the wrong temperature
attributes.additional_details:
The world is under threat from the effects of global warming.

Legislating for improved fridge efficiency should help reduce our carbon footprint and prevent climate change.

Fridge doors may be useful, but can cause problems with hygiene (particularly since the covid-19 pandemic) and for people with mobility issues. Therefore the aim should be improving efficiency whilst maintaining the open design if possible.

I propose legislating for a target of 50% improvement in energy efficiency over the next 10 years.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Ban the manufacture and sale of dog waste bags not made of plant-based material
attributes.background: Ban the manufacture and sale of plastic (including degradable) dog waste bags to reduce use of petroleum and to cut CO2 emissions and plastic pollution.
attributes.additional_details:
Millions of dog waste bags are thrown away every day. Some into trees!

The vast majority are made of plastic, and are not recyclable by their use. Even degradable plastic uses petroleum products and degrades to form CO2. 

There's a clear strategy by the vendors of the degradable bags to make them seem environmentally friendly as people don't appreciate they help cause global warming. 

Plant-based bags (e.g. corn starch) are sustainable and non-polluting. We already use them as food waste bags.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Seek binding agreement at COP26 to make it mandatory to teach climate change.
attributes.background: Earth is trapping unprecedented amounts of heat evidenced by NASA reports, the Global warming index Oxford University and the draft UN report. Unfortunately the world population is less well aware and educated about the long term consequences of climate change that outweigh the Covid pandemic.
attributes.additional_details: The UK government has a great opportunity at COP26 to seek a binding agreement for individual countries within their different educational systems to make climate change a mandatory curriculum course to inspire innovation and awareness at tertiary and school institutions. There is a cost for lack of knowledge and a opportunity for the economics of climate change.

departments.name: Cabinet Office

attributes.action: Make All Animal Hunting Illegal
attributes.background: A lot of animal hunting in England is illegal, but not all of it. Some bird hunting for game is legal and that needs to stop. Humans shouldn’t kill wild animals just to have fun or as a sport, or for food.
attributes.additional_details: Animal hunting is cruel and unnecessary, especially when it is just for a sport or game. Humans are already ruining the planet with global warming and cutting down the rainforests, so many animals are already dying. We don’t need more dying just because humans want to have fun or eat game. Animals deserve to live too.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Add sustainability to the National Curriculum
attributes.background: I would like the government to add a sustainability to the national curriculum and start teaching how our actions and decisions impact the world.
attributes.additional_details:
We are at a critical point in the world with CO2 levels at a record high, over fishing killing our seas, deforestation occurring at an alarming rate, global warming causing terrifying conditions globally.

Education is vital to ensure people support the positive actions towards a better future within the near future. Without education the nation will not actively support the changes required!

departments.name: Department for Education

attributes.action: Withdraw from the Paris agreement related to climate change
attributes.background: The Paris Agreement is a legally binding international treaty on climate change.
attributes.additional_details:
Its goal is to limit global warming to well below 2, preferably to 1.5 degrees Celsius, compared to pre-industrial levels.
 
I am asking the Government to pull out of this agreement.
 
I believe the government has been spending too much money on providing cleaner energy, which is a problem when the national deficit is too high. An example is subsidies to those building wind turbines. I believe this Paris agreement is influencing road taxes for car users as the Government tries to meet its climate goals. Also, businesses may face higher taxes, later on, to pay back the national deficit. I believe that to improve our economy and financial well-being we need to pull out of the Paris agreement.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Take action to tackle global deforestation
attributes.background: The Government should implement policies to seek to tackle global deforestation including carbon trading schemes, diplomatic measures to pressure foreign governments to tackle deforestation, and use of sanctions against governments involved in deforestation.
attributes.additional_details: Global deforestation is a major contributing factor to both global warming and climate change. Both of these are existential threats to our planet so we must take all possible steps to counter them.

departments.name: Foreign, Commonwealth & Development Office

attributes.action: Require shops to have their lights switched off after closing
attributes.background: Many establishments still have lights or screens switched on after closing every day. This wastes electricity and causes more fossil fuels to be burned, which contributes to global warming. If the government were to force shops to switch off electronics overnight, this could be prevented.
attributes.additional_details: The continued use of electricity causes more fossil fuels to be burned—these produce greenhouse gases, which contribute to global warming. This causes climate change, which, if not acted on before 2030 (according to the UN Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change in 2018), will become irreversible, bringing about the end of life on Earth. This rule (above) would lead to a smaller amount of fossil fuels being burned, lessening the country’s carbon footprint and helping to prevent climate change.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Increase support for nuclear power to reduce reliance on fossil fuels
attributes.background: We need to open more, and keep open longer nuclear power plants to reduce our reliance on burning fossil fuels which contributes to global warming, while creating robust storage and systems for the processing of toxic waste. This would be a huge step in reducing our output of greenhouse gases.
attributes.additional_details: Nuclear power has caused relatively few deaths in comparison with the most conservative estimates of the respiratory illness and other impacts of climate change on humans. If we replace fossil fuels, this should help slow global warming and mitigate its impacts. Nuclear power is statistically much safer than many people believe and it should be exploited fully to fulfil our responsibility to take care of the Earth for future generations.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Increase funding for public transport to make it cheaper than private transport
attributes.background: Public transportation is often more expensive than private cars. This does not make sense and within the context of global warming and too much pollution which is damaging people’s health. In order to reduce the number of cars on the road the Government should make public transport cheaper.
attributes.additional_details: There are too many private vehicles on the roads, increasing co2 levels and pollution. The price of public transport, and especially trains, means it is often not affordable to many people, leaving those who need them most unable to access public transport. The Government should increase funding for public transport so that this becomes cheaper than private transport, and more accessible to all irrespective of income.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Ban All Commercial Flights On Sundays
attributes.background: Take the lessons learnt from the inflicted global shutdown to benefit the planet and prevent further global warming and pollution by banning all commercial flying on Sundays.
attributes.additional_details:
The Coronavirus is a global tragedy, on all levels personal, social and economically.  However, we are already seeing the incredible benefits to the environment. 

What mustn't happen is for Covid-19 to come, kill, destroy and leave without us learning from the tragedies that have occurred. Lets recognise the benefits of global shutdown on the environment, how it's helping heal our world and make changes for the better.  One day a week of no commercial flying would allow the planet to breathe.

departments.name: Department for Transport

attributes.action: Ban outdoor fossil fuel heaters of all types.
attributes.background: Ban the sale and use of outdoor fossil fuel heaters immediately.
attributes.additional_details: They contradict all our efforts to reduce global warming and hamper the impetus to go carbon neutral, if people are cold outdoors they should put on an extra layer of clothes.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Reform legislation that allows plastics to go undeclared on textile labels
attributes.background: The Government should require the full disclosure of all fossil fuel derived plastics in textiles and clothing.
attributes.additional_details:
The Textile Products Regulations allows some parts, which often contain fossil fuel derived materials, to not be listed on composition labels in clothing and textile products.
 
Plastic production from fossil fuels for synthetic fibres is increasing. Fossil fuel extraction is the primary cause of our climate crisis. Recycling is not a solution.
 
We believe incomplete labelling of textile products is a silent contributor to the catastrophe of global warming and plastic and microplastic pollution that’s devastating our ecosystems. Obscuring the full facts denies UK citizens the choice of reducing their plastic footprint.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Ban the sale of petrol powered garden tools to encourage shift to alternatives
attributes.background: With the world in the grips of an environmental crisis there is absolutely no excuse for the continued use of garden tools that pollute the atmosphere with chemicals and noise, damage people's health, and perpetuate our reliance on fossil fuels.
attributes.additional_details:
Petrol machinery produces airborne pollution that can impair breathing & aggravate existing heart & lung conditions.
 
The US Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has estimated that a lawnmower can produce the same air pollution as 11 cars. A Swedish study has also found that the emissions from a petrol mower used for one hour are equivalent to those released by a car on a 100-mile journey.
 
A ban on the sale of petrol powered garden tools would encourage a shift to battery powered garden tools. This should improve air quality and could help tackle global warming.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Abolish VAT on all Electric Vehicles.
attributes.background: Government should exempt electric vehicles from VAT.
attributes.additional_details: Government’s plug-in grant up to £2500 toward the electric cars are not enough. Government  would need to take drastic steps to tackle global warming and for cleaner environment. Scraping VAT on electric vehicles would make Electric vehicles more affordable and it should encourage business and public to choose Electric vehicle over the Diesel or Petrol.

departments.name: HM Treasury

attributes.action: To save energy, require shops to keep their doors closed during opening hours.
attributes.background: Introduce legislation requiring all shops to have their doors closed (that is, not fixed open) during opening hours. This proposal is prompted by both the current high cost of energy, and wasting precious energy and the costs of producing it on a planet that is experiencing global warming.
attributes.additional_details: We all understand that shops need to be welcoming to customers, but customers should quickly realise that a closed door does not mean a closed shop. Many shops appear to put fear of missing out on potential customers above the desire to conserve energy - whether heating or air conditioning, No shop should feel disadvantaged if all shops were required by law to have their doors closed so as reduce energy waste.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Ban The fireworks
attributes.background: Ban the fireworks
attributes.additional_details: Ban fireworks as they are dangerous and toxic for humans, pets and wild animals , can also cause fire and contribute to the global warming. We must change and be more sustainable.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/626850

attributes.action: SAVE BANGLADESH
attributes.background: Pledge Emergency aid and support to victims of extreme flooding in Bangladesh - a key exporter of clothing bringing billions to UK economy. Victims will require support with locating their families, accessing clean drinking water, emergency rehousing, food, clothes, medical treatment and relocating.
attributes.additional_details: Bangladesh is the leader in garment manufacturing and it boosts the UK economy. H&M, Boohoo, ASOS, ZARA, Gap all use Bangladeshi factories to produce their clothes. We must support them through this environmental & humanitarian crisis caused by climate change and global warming. We rely on Bangladesh for its affordable labour and it is in our best interests to save this country from going under water. Bangladesh is projected to become a low-middle income country by 2026 and is tackling poverty.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action:  https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/618691

attributes.action: Ban single-use plastics in the UK, akin to laws passed in other countries.
attributes.background: At a time when global warming and massive pollution are becoming more pressing issues, more needs to change. A ban on the sale of single use plastics, such as utensils, straws, cup lids, single use plastic bottles and more, could have a big impact on this.
attributes.additional_details: 4.8-12.7 million tonnes of plastic enter the ocean each year https://www.nhm.ac.uk/discover/quick-questions/how-much-plastic-is-in-the-ocean.html

rejection.details:
We currently have the following petition open which you might like to sign:

Ban All Single Use Plastics and Plastic Packaging to Save Our Planet
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/607466

attributes.action: Organise an international environmental conference on restoring the Aral Sea
attributes.background: I want the Government to start talks with climate and marine scientists and Heads of State to take action on Sea Level Rise (SLR).
attributes.additional_details:
This conference should explore the potential construction of a pipeline from the Black Sea to pump water to the dried up Aral Sea basin to restore the Aral Sea, which should reduce the effects of SLR.

SLR will affect countless populations causing potentially trillions of dollars of damage. Cutting greenhouse gasses will only go so far. I propose a new plan of action to slow and reduce SLR by restoring the Aral Sea! It doesn't take a genius to realize that if you take water out of the ocean that it will reduce its overall volume. Once the Aral Sea is restored it should help stabilize global weather patterns and also absorb CO2 from the atmosphere thereby slowing global warming, climate change and SLR.

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Reinstate capital punishment for sound minded murders of children and vulnerable
attributes.background: Global warming, population and unfair justice need contributory solutions. Imposing the death sentence to those of sound mind who act on the intent to maliciously kill a child and/or vulnerable adult, beyond all reasonable doubt would bring a fair carriage of justice and contribute to a safer world.
attributes.additional_details: Because if the Government doesn’t, the incomprehensible crime will continue, incarcerated vigilantes will continue to inflict further punishment to these types of offenders as a result of common unsatisfactory justice. This imposes further punishment on the lesser offender who inflicts his/her own carriage of justice. In turn, the Taxpayers and Government make increased contributions to the imprisonment of all offenders involved for an even longer duration.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Bring back the death penalty for convicted murderers: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/601972

attributes.action: A law to be passed that forces all UK retailers to have a “UK produce” filter
attributes.background: I wish to make it easier for UK citizens to support UK business by forcing retail in the UK to make it easier for customers to limit their shopping to UK only produce
attributes.additional_details: I believe in a post Brexit economy and in these times of global warming it’s important that we enable consumers to make decisions to support produce that is made in the UK and has travelled the least amount of distance

rejection.details:
The Government is not responsible for how retailers structure their website. This is a matter for individual retailers.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign: 

Make Internet sellers list goods' country of origin: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317819

attributes.action: UK Environmental Protection Act
attributes.background: Create & implement a UK wide environmental protection act. To preserve, restore and protect the UK and worldwide climate. Implementing rules, guidelines and sanctions for all businesses, general public, government and public services. To protect the health of individuals and the environment.
attributes.additional_details: To guide and build the public and businesses into a sustainable economy that protects and preserves the environment. It is the only way to ensure true sustainability. To make the move needed to reduce global warming and dangerous climate change that will have detrimental effects on economies, migration, crops, wildlife, disease, and many more factors. Human driven climate change is the biggest danger to our lives in the near future and change needs to happen. The UK should lead the way.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the environment, but we're not sure exactly what new laws you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

An Environment Bill, to make provision about targets, plans and policies for improving the natural environment; for statements and reports about environmental protection; for the Office for Environmental Protection; about waste and resource efficiency; about air quality; for the recall of products that fail to meet environmental standards; about water; about nature and biodiversity; for conservation covenants; about the regulation of chemicals; and for connected purposes, is already being considered by Parliament. You can find out more about this Bill here: https://bills.parliament.uk/bills/2593

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Create a Water Resource Balancing and Infrastructure Strategy for England
attributes.background: The evidence is clear that due to global warming, the supply of water in England is becoming more regionalised with some areas having more supply than needed and some areas not having enough. What is needed is a joined up strategy that defines a network of supply capacity and pipelines in England
attributes.additional_details: England has a fragmented approach to water infrastructure, capture, storage and supply. Why are reservoirs in North of England full and the South has a water shortage? Pipelines were built during WW2 to transport fuel on an England wide basis and still in use today. Libya built a national pipeline infrastructure to transport its water across the country, so why cant we as a country? England is a world leader in national infrastructure projects and this is seems like a BIG gap in that capability

departments.name: Department for Environment, Food and Rural Affairs

attributes.action: Make David Attenboroughs "A Life on Our Planet" mandatory for all U.K. schools.
attributes.background: Due to the current environmental issues facing our planet we believe it should be mandatory for all schools in the U.K. to show David Attenboroughs a life on our planet documentary film. This is so education and knowledge of this crucial issue is available and accessible for the younger generation.
attributes.additional_details: It is the worlds greatest problem and only we have the means to solve it. Global warming and other environmental problems will be the problems of future generations, we believe it is essential for the younger generation to be aware of what is happening to the natural world and what they can do to change it. Therefore we want David Attenboroughs film to be readily available for children in all schools, as it presents a clear message of what we have done to the world and what we can do to save it.

rejection.details:
The educational materials used to teach school students is a matter for individual schools, not the Government or House of Commons.

We have published the following related petition, which you might like to sign:

Introduce a Climate Change subject to the National School Curriculum: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318835

attributes.action: Reduce Climate Warming
attributes.background: Pass Laws that will allow CNG and LNG be available at filling stations. For private cars
attributes.additional_details: Make Non Global Warming Gases available for cars

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. LNG are CNG are not non-polluting gasses, as they still contribute to climate emissions according to scientific research, see for example: 

https://www.reuters.com/article/us-climate-change-gas-idUSKBN247303

We could accept a petition calling for the UK Government to allow vehicles to be powered by CNG and LNG without requiring speciifc permission, if that's what you'd like to see happen.

attributes.action: Make sustainability a core subject in School syllabus and adult education
attributes.background:
Make sustainability a core or mandatory subject in School syllabus, College and University courses, post graduate courses, driving, health and safety courses, site inductions etc.

Making this vital subject mandatory will educate the nation to focus on a sustainable future for our world.
attributes.additional_details:
We are at a critical point in the world with CO2 levels at a record high, over fishing killing our seas, deforestation occurring at an alarming rate, global warming causing terrifying conditions globally.

Education is vital to ensure people support the positive actions toward a better future within the near future. Without education the nation will not actively support the changes required! This not only needs to target children but also adults, as adults are the primary problem.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The UK Government aren't responsible for the content of college and university courses, postgraduate courses, driving, health and safety courses, site inductions etc.

You could start a petition calling for sustainability to be added to the National Curriculum, if that's something you'd like to see happen.

attributes.action: Make work from home a worker's right.
attributes.background: During the Covid-19 pandemic, offices were closed, workers in mass were sent to work from home. This had shown great benefits for workers, businesses and the environment. With modern technology, many workers can work from home and do their job. Work from home should become a modern worker's right.
attributes.additional_details:
Working from home has be found to add great benefit to society at large. More time spent with family and friends due to no longer needing to commute, resulted in greater mental well-being. This is turn reduced stress levels and better child welfare. This is a key step to improving  societal health, and lowering the burden on the NHS.

Emissions have been reduced as less people cram into cars for a daily commute. With the advent of global warming, this helps the U' become carbon neutral.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318057

attributes.action: Add more bike lanes around London.
attributes.background: Use more money on bike lanes rather then moterway to reduce congestion, help stop global warming, boost the economy and reduce death on the road.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about local road improvements in London are a matter for Transport for London, the Mayor of London and the London Assembly, not the UK Government or Parliament.

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions

attributes.action: Resolve the energy crisis through Green energy not by fracking or oil and gas
attributes.background: Resolve the energy crisis by investing in green energy; green energy comes on stream about as quickly as new oil and gas or fracking but doesn't harm the environment. It is also sustainable and lower cost. End the exploration of new oil and gas fields and fracking and back green energy instead.
attributes.additional_details:
Resolving our energy crisis by extracting every last drop of oil, every last whiff of gas, and by fracking will contribute to global warming. Global warming is already causing widespread problems, it would be selfish to contribute further to those.
There is no advantage to turning to oil and gas, for instance offshore wind farms can be built in about the same timescale (and in some cases faster) than new oil and gas. Green energy (on or offshore) will reduce energy prices and help the climate.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Keep The Fracking Ban: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/614611

Address the Energy, Climate and Environment crisis by investing in Renewables: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617729

Decommission all fossil fuel power stations by 2023: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/620604

Set a target for 70% of UK energy to be renewable by 2030: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/612739

If you'd like the Government to take a specific action different to the above petitions we could accept a new petition about this, but it would need to be clear what specific actions you want the Government to take.

attributes.action: On-line sellers must state the country of manufacture in the product description
attributes.background: Without the requirement to state the country of manufacture or where it is being shipped from we are unwittingly exacerbating the problem of global warming by having goods shipped to the UK from around the world, and possibly buying products from countries we would rather not be trading with.
attributes.additional_details: By purchasing products that originate from certain countries around the world we are effectively condoning the actions of the governments in power in those countries.   I do not wish to see  money  being used by any regime to fund their ideologies and potentially increase their power in a way that may negatively impact their own citizens lives or even ours in the UK.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317819

attributes.action: Stop the unprecedented rise in energy bills.
attributes.background: The significanct rise in energy bills are unjust.  Whilst the population struggle to survive in a 1st world country, energy providers report record breaking profits.  I am calling on the UK Government to urgently reduce the energy price caps to a sensible level, before the winter months arrive.
attributes.additional_details: The UK population simply cannot afford to sustain this way of life, where the decision to eat Vs the decision to heat is a very real threat to life. This affects everyone and is catastrophic to every day life.  It is understandable that prices rise and the war in Ukraine, global warming and various other economic factors all affect this.  However, energy providers are reporting record profits at the expense of the UK population.  Energy is essential for modern day life, please step-up.

rejection.details:
The calculation of the energy price cap is a matter for the regulator Ofgem, which is operationally independent of the UK Government and House of Commons. You can find out more about how the price cap is calculated here: https://www.ofgem.gov.uk/information-consumers/energy-advice-households/check-if-energy-price-cap-affects-you.

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Temporarily suspend all taxes on all fuels and energy bills: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/610585

Subsidise a 'basic' amount of electricity for households: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/616915

Establish a not-for-profit state owned energy provider: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617446

Introduce a "Triple lock" to restrict energy cap increases: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/621347

attributes.action: Ban the use of excess unnecessary food packaging.
attributes.background: Ban the use of excessive packaging on all prepackaged food items (eg crisp , breakfast bars). As it causes an unnecessary amount of waste , which majority of the time is not recyclable . This waste goes to landfill and then in turn will contributor to global warming.
attributes.additional_details: Prepackaged foods are causing an unnecessary amount of waste because a large majority of their manufacturers are oversizing there the wrappers and container that protect them so that there products appeared bigger than there actual size. This can been seen crisp packaging (eg, walkers) and breakfast (eg, Cadbury’s brunch bars). Landfill contributes to climate change as greenhouse gases are released, less landfill equals ,less Greenhouse gases being released Equals, less global warming .

rejection.details:
We understand that you are concerned about unnecessary food packaging, but it's not clear what you want the Government to ban.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Make it compulsory for food products to have environmental impact traffic lights: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300770

Ban all single use plastic: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300152

Ban selling drinks bottles that aren’t made out of a sustainable material: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/311520

Create charge for use of non-biodegradable material: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300421

We could accept a new petition calling for additional restrictions on food packaging, but it would need to be clear what additional restrictions you wanted the Government to impose.

attributes.action: Crack down on the meat and dairy industry and eventually ban their production
attributes.background: Laws and regulations need to be immediately introduced to crack down on the meat and dairy industry. A safety net and re-hiring scheme also needs to be set up for farmers who will be out of work. Education on the effects of a meat and dairy diet must also become compulsory for pupils at school.
attributes.additional_details: The meat and dairy industry is one of the driving forces of global warming and the increase in greenhouse gases. It is also the main cause of the UK’s number 1 killer; heart disease. Heart attacks are most often caused by cholesterol that is only found in animal products. By eventually banning meat and dairy, it will save our struggling NHS millions of pounds annually. Our Government is claiming to care for the environment, animals and our health, then why not tackle the worst thing for these?

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/330298

attributes.action: Create a National Water Resource Balancing and Infrastructure Strategy
attributes.background: The evidence is clear that due to global warming, the supply of water as a UK wide resource is becoming more regionalised with some areas having more supply than needed and some areas not having enough. What is needed is a joined up UK strategy that defines a network of supply capacity and pipelines
attributes.additional_details: The UK has a fragmented approach to water infrastructure, capture, storage and supply.  Why are Northern, Scottish and Welsh reservoirs are full and the South has a water shortage? Pipelines were built during the WW2 to transport fuel on a national basis. Libya built a national pipeline infrastructure to transport its water across the country, so why cant we as a nation? The UK is a world leader in national infrastructure projects and this is seems like a BIG gap in that capability

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise.  Water is devolved to Scotland and Wales. 

We could accept a petition calling for the Government to develop a Water Resource Balancing and Infrastructure Strategy for England, if that's something you'd like to see happen.

attributes.action: Make a stronger climate deal by the end of COP 27, Egypt
attributes.background: The task of the COP 26 climate change conference in Glasgow is not complete. In the face of a climate change emergency the deal was a small step, when we urgently need to take a giant leap forward. We must plan, negotiate, and agree on a much stronger global climate deal by the end of COP 27, Egypt.
attributes.additional_details:
In COP26 we agreed emissions cuts that, if fully adhered to, will limit global warming to around 2.4C, nowhere near the 1.5C target agreed by scientists and politicians. Please take a moment to watch Alok Sharma, the president of the COP26 summit, summarize what was achieved at the conference: https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-59277788

We must set serious targets for the next decade, not far in the future. And we must eradicate coal as a power source, not merely "phase it down".

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you want to see a stronger climate deal, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government to do, or try to secure in a future deal.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Save the Upper Nene Valley countryside from massive industrialisation.
attributes.background:
Stop the large number of distribution centres currently being planned on good agricultural land within the Upper Nene Valley.

Ensure speculative developers are not allowed to exploit budget constrained councils into permitting inappropriate and unsustainable development for short term profit.
attributes.additional_details:
Villages and towns in this beautiful rural area are becoming inundated with large ugly warehouses and more are being planned.

The increase in heavy goods vehicles and subsequent air, noise and light pollution will result in a reduction in the quality of life for all residents in the Upper Nene Valley.

Increased industrialization will contribute to global warming, flooding and climate change.

This loss of countryside will reduce the diversity of plants, animals and birds, never to be regained.

rejection.details:
Local planning decisions within the Upper Nene Valley are a matter for the individual local authority, not the Government or Parliament. As a result it is not possible for the Government or Parliament to take the action you have requested.

If you are concerned about planning decisions in your area you could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

attributes.action: Make all packaging recyclable or compostable clearly stating how to dispose it.
attributes.background: We propose a new incentive scheme to get all businesses selling goods to replace all “not yet recycled” packaging with recyclable, recycled, reusable, upcycled or compostable packaging instead. Not only will this tackle the global crisis this has the potential to save a substantial amount of money.
attributes.additional_details: Common plastic packaging contributes to the emission greenhouse gasses into the atmosphere, which contributes further to global warming. Plastic packaging needs to be replaced with sustainable alternatives and clearly state how they should be reused or disregarded. In turn this could help save our planet, save our money and create new jobs. We do not have much time left, we must act now. This is an emergency.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552450

attributes.action: Use the current situation as a basis to reduce climate change and global warming
attributes.background: To use this opportunity as a basis for continued reductions in GHGs, by continuing to lower their reliance on fossil fuels, after this pandemic. Further they should increase the ability to work from home, free access to Internet, renewable energy, reduce meat production and dependence.
attributes.additional_details: We have seen unprecedented improvements to our seas and cities since this lockdown. Venice is crystal clear, the sky's are bluer, and animals have taken over the parks. This shows us how much the world can improve in such a short time and we should not erase this progress and "return to normal" we need a new normal that fully addresses the growing issues of global warming, climate change and continued environmental degradation.

rejection.details:

attributes.action: Carbon impact labeling on food- a simple R/A/G system to inform choices.
attributes.background: Enact legislation for all food to carry a simple rag label to show its impact on carbon emissions. An emissions tax or variable VAT rate could be introduced later based on the same system.
attributes.additional_details: If it is not law it won’t happen. The gov introduced a sugar tax-global warming is a far greater threat.

attributes.action: Every house should have a solar panel by the end of 2025
attributes.background: I want the government to make a law on using solar panels on the roof of most if not all houses to stop green house gasses
attributes.additional_details: It turns out that 25% of global warming happens because of our electric. This is a massive problem as the earth is supposed to warm up 1 degree in about 5000 years instead of 20 and if we don’t act now 60% of all living creatures including plants will die in about 60 or so years and this will cause a mass extinction. Thank you

rejection.details:
It's not clear whether your petition relates to new or existing properties, or both, but the Government is only responsible for setting rules for new build properties, and adaptions to existing properties. The Government would not therefore mandate that solar panels need to be installed on existing properties.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign: 

Make it law for all new builds to include green energy solutions: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/332338

You could start a petition calling on the Government to provide funding for installation of solar panels on existing residential properties, if that is something you want to happen.
